description: From Latin resalutare; or formed from re- +‎ salute.

verbs.description: resalute (third-person singular simple present resalutes, present participle resaluting, simple past and past participle resaluted)

examples: Hippocrates, after a little pause, saluted him by his name, whom he resaluted, ashamed almost that he could not call him likewise by his, or that he had forgot it.
